title: CVE-1999-0095
text: The debug command in Sendmail is enabled, allowing attackers to execute commands as root.
explanation: The debug command in Sendmail is enabled, allowing attackers to execute commands as root.

title: CVE-1999-0082
text: CWD ~root command in ftpd allows root access.
explanation: CWD ~root command in ftpd allows root access.

title: CVE-1999-1471
text: Buffer overflow in passwd in BSD based operating systems 4.3 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges by specifying a long shell or GECOS field.
explanation: Buffer overflow in passwd in BSD based operating systems 4.3 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges by specifying a long shell or GECOS field.

title: CVE-1999-1122
text: Vulnerability in restore in SunOS 4.0.3 and earlier allows local users to gain privileges.
explanation: Vulnerability in restore in SunOS 4.0.3 and earlier allows local users to gain privileges.

title: CVE-1999-1467
text: Vulnerability in rcp on SunOS 4.0.x allows remote attackers from trusted hosts to execute arbitrary commands as root, possibly related to the configuration of the nobody user.
explanation: Vulnerability in rcp on SunOS 4.0.x allows remote attackers from trusted hosts to execute arbitrary commands as root, possibly related to the configuration of the nobody user.

title: CVE-1999-1506
text: Vulnerability in SMI Sendmail 4.0 and earlier, on SunOS up to 4.0.3, allows remote attackers to access user bin.
explanation: Vulnerability in SMI Sendmail 4.0 and earlier, on SunOS up to 4.0.3, allows remote attackers to access user bin.

title: CVE-1999-0084
text: Certain NFS servers allow users to use mknod to gain privileges by creating a writable kmem device and setting the UID to 0.
explanation: Certain NFS servers allow users to use mknod to gain privileges by creating a writable kmem device and setting the UID to 0.

title: CVE-2000-0388
text: Buffer overflow in FreeBSD libmytinfo library allows local users to execute commands via a long TERMCAP environmental variable.
explanation: Buffer overflow in FreeBSD libmytinfo library allows local users to execute commands via a long TERMCAP environmental variable.

title: CVE-1999-0209
text: The SunView (SunTools) selection_svc facility allows remote users to read files.
explanation: The SunView (SunTools) selection_svc facility allows remote users to read files.

title: CVE-1999-1198
text: BuildDisk program on NeXT systems before 2.0 does not prompt users for the root password, which allows local users to gain root privileges.
explanation: BuildDisk program on NeXT systems before 2.0 does not prompt users for the root password, which allows local users to gain root privileges.

title: CVE-1999-1391
text: Vulnerability in NeXT 1.0a and 1.0 with publicly accessible printers allows local users to gain privileges via a combination of the npd program and weak directory permissions.
explanation: Vulnerability in NeXT 1.0a and 1.0 with publicly accessible printers allows local users to gain privileges via a combination of the npd program and weak directory permissions.

title: CVE-1999-1392
text: Vulnerability in restore0.9 installation script in NeXT 1.0a and 1.0 allows local users to gain root privileges.
explanation: Vulnerability in restore0.9 installation script in NeXT 1.0a and 1.0 allows local users to gain root privileges.

title: CVE-1999-1057
text: VMS 4.0 through 5.3 allows local users to gain privileges via the ANALYZE/PROCESS_DUMP dcl command.
explanation: VMS 4.0 through 5.3 allows local users to gain privileges via the ANALYZE/PROCESS_DUMP dcl command.

title: CVE-1999-1554
text: /usr/sbin/Mail on SGI IRIX 3.3 and 3.3.1 does not properly set the group ID to the group ID of the user who started Mail, which allows local users to read the mail of other users.
explanation: /usr/sbin/Mail on SGI IRIX 3.3 and 3.3.1 does not properly set the group ID to the group ID of the user who started Mail, which allows local users to read the mail of other users.

title: CVE-1999-1197
text: TIOCCONS in SunOS 4.1.1 does not properly check the permissions of a user who tries to redirect console output and input, which could allow a local user to gain privileges.
explanation: TIOCCONS in SunOS 4.1.1 does not properly check the permissions of a user who tries to redirect console output and input, which could allow a local user to gain privileges.

title: CVE-1999-1115
text: Vulnerability in the /etc/suid_exec program in HP Apollo Domain/OS sr10.2 and sr10.3 beta, related to the Korn Shell (ksh).
explanation: Vulnerability in the /etc/suid_exec program in HP Apollo Domain/OS sr10.2 and sr10.3 beta, related to the Korn Shell (ksh).

title: CVE-1999-1258
text: rpc.pwdauthd in SunOS 4.1.1 and earlier does not properly prevent remote access to the daemon, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive system information.
explanation: rpc.pwdauthd in SunOS 4.1.1 and earlier does not properly prevent remote access to the daemon, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive system information.

title: CVE-1999-1438
text: Vulnerability in /bin/mail in SunOS 4.1.1 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges via certain command line arguments.
explanation: Vulnerability in /bin/mail in SunOS 4.1.1 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges via certain command line arguments.

title: CVE-1999-1211
text: Vulnerability in in.telnetd in SunOS 4.1.1 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges.
explanation: Vulnerability in in.telnetd in SunOS 4.1.1 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges.

title: CVE-1999-1212
text: Vulnerability in in.rlogind in SunOS 4.0.3 and 4.0.3c allows local users to gain root privileges.
explanation: Vulnerability in in.rlogind in SunOS 4.0.3 and 4.0.3c allows local users to gain root privileges.

title: Credential harvesting phishing
text: Urgent: Your mailbox will be deactivated. Click https://secure-login.example.com to verify credentials.
explanation: Phishing URL impersonating mailbox provider to harvest credentials.

title: CVE-2024-9999 - Buffer overflow RCE
text: CVE-2024-9999: Buffer overflow in ABC service allows remote code execution via crafted packet.
explanation: Remote code execution possible via crafted packet in ABC service.

title: New ransomware campaign
text: A new ransomware family 'LockIt' encrypts files and drops ransom_note.txt; observed contacting 203.0.113.45.
explanation: Ransomware that encrypts files and contacts command-and-control IP.

title: Malicious attachment trojan
text: Invoice attached invoice_638.exe — contains trojan that opens backdoor.
explanation: Attachment drops a backdoor Trojan when executed.

title: APT group exploiting zero-day
text: State actor group exploits 0-day in VPN gateway to persist on networks.
explanation: Long-term targeted intrusion using a zero-day in VPN gateway.
